meanings.definition: A pair of photographs that give a three-dimensional effect when viewed together.
meanings.sent1: I looked at the stereographs of the mountains and felt like I could reach out and touch them.
meanings.sent2: The museum had a collection of stereographs from the 19th century on display.
meanings.sent3: When the kids saw the stereographs of animals, they tried to pet them through the pictures!
meanings.sent4: Her memories were like a collection of stereographs, each one vivid and distinct.
meanings.sent5: The artist used stereographs to capture the beauty of nature in a unique way.

meanings.sent1: We learned how to stereograph the images to create a 3D effect.
meanings.sent2: He stereographs the pictures to make them pop out when viewed through special glasses.
meanings.sent3: The magician claimed he could stereograph a picture to make it come to life.
meanings.sent4: She stereographs the landscapes to make them look more realistic.
meanings.sent5: The photographer loves to stereograph scenes to add depth to his work.
